abstracts.cdata!:
The project gave outstanding results,
            showing highly satisfactory ratings on project outcome, and
            performances by the Bank, and Borrower, highly likely
            sustainability, and substantial institutional development.
            Key lessons include: 1) the replicability of lessons quoted
            in the appraisal documentation, i.e., need for strong local
            leadership, attention to Borrower's view, fast tracking
            of project processing, and minimization of cash flow
            bottlenecks, appropriately taken into account for project
            design, and implementation arrangements, and, at the same
            time, general suggestions from emergency operations, e.g.,
            longer implementation period, were correctly, discarded by
            the project team in this specific case; 2) the adequate
            attention given to project preparation, and design
            simplicity, which avoided overburdening the reconstruction
            effort, conditionality, studies, and surveys. The selection
            of components focused around the life of communities, such
            as the reconstruction of basic services to support their
            livelihoods, a relevant, and responsive approach; 3) the
            flexible procurement methods, such as force account to
            construct small works, conducive to an effective
            implementation; 4) the introduction of seismic-resistant
            construction methods, a key element for sustainability,
            which included training, and dissemination of these
            practices; 5) the close consultation with beneficiaries -
            for both reconstruction, and poverty alleviation components
            - which ensured project representation in the smallest
            villages, and a fast implementation; and, 6) the successful
            economic rehabilitation, attained through the provision of
            infrastructure reconstruction, reduced vulnerability of
            local populations, and strengthened social capacity.
